intro: Echinopanax japonicus, commonly known as Japanese hedge or Japanese spurge, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia, particularly Japan and parts of Korea. The plant features a thick, fleshy rhizome and has compound leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically clustered in umbels. Echinopanax japonicus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and hardy nature.
